meanings.sent1: The old door was so screaky that it woke up the whole house.
meanings.sent2: The screaky violin produced a sharp, high-pitched tone.
meanings.sent3: The screaky floorboard sounded like a mouse tap-dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as screaky as a rusty swing set in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The screaky voice of the singer pierced through the quiet room.

meanings.sent1: The screaky stairs announced our arrival in the silent house.
meanings.sent2: The screaky old chair protested loudly when sat upon.
meanings.sent3: The screaky door seemed to have a conversation with the wind.
meanings.sent4: The screaky floor echoed with every step, like a symphony of protests.
meanings.sent5: The screaky hinges of the gate added a spooky atmosphere to the garden.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched sound, especially when moving or opening
meanings.sent1: She carefully opened the screaky window to let in some fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The rusty swing set screaked as the children played on it.
meanings.sent3: The old bicycle screaked as he pedaled down the street, drawing attention.
meanings.sent4: The door screaked open, revealing a dusty room filled with memories.
meanings.sent5: The gate screaked shut behind him, sealing off the outside world.
